title: US condemns deadly Israeli airstrike in Rafah – NBC New York
message:
The White House on Tuesday condemned the loss of life of dozens of civilians as a result of an Israeli airstrike in Rafah, but said it is not planning any policy changes as a result of the Israeli actions.
“Everything that we can see tells us that they are not moving into a major ground operation in population centers in the center of Rafah," Kirby said.
“We understand that this strike did kill two senior Hamas heads who are directly responsible for attacks,” Kirby said.
The U.S. had urged Israel not to replicate those earlier attacks in Rafah, given the vulnerable civilians crowded there.
Singh said the U.S. has not paused shipments to Israel in the wake of the strike.

title: White House insists Israel airstrike on Rafah did NOT cross a  red line  despite killing dozens of civilians and there is still  no major ground operation
message:
The White House on Tuesday defended U.S. ally Israel's response to the airstrike that killed dozens of civilians in Gaza, even comparing the tragic error to U.S. strikes in Iraq and Afghanistan.
'We have conducted airstrikes in places like Iraq and Afghanistan where, tragically, we caused civilian casualties,' White House national security spokesman John Kirby told reporters at the White House.
'Everything that we can see tells us that they are not moving into a major ground operation in population centers in the center of Rafah,' Kirby said.
And Qatar, a key mediator in attempts to secure a cease-fire and the release of hostages held by Hamas, said the Rafah strike could 'complicate' talks.
The U.S. had urged Israel not to replicate those earlier attacks in Rafah, given the vulnerable civilians crowded there.

title: Hamas munitions likely caused fire in Rafah DP camp , says Israel
message:
Tel Aviv [Israel], May 29 (ANI/TPS): A fire at a displaced persons camp in Rafah following an airstrike was likely caused by Hamas munitions, according to a preliminary military investigation, the Israel Defense Forces said on Tuesday.
The Sunday night airstrike killed Hamas commanders Yassin Rabia and Khaled Nagar in a compound in the Rafah neighborhood of Tel Sultan.
The military believes the fire was likely caused by secondary explosions from Hamas munitions or some other material it was not aware of.
The IDF also released a recording of two Rafah residents specifically saying the fire was caused by Hamas explosives.
Israel took control of the Palestinian side of the Rafah border crossing on May 7 to prevent Hamas from commandeering humanitarian aid deliveries from Egypt.
event_breakdown:
1. Airstrike in Rafah
2. Fire at a displaced persons camp in Rafah
3. Military investigation by Israel claim the fire could have been caused by secondary explosions from Hamas munitions.

title: Chicago police fatally shoot stabbing suspect , wound the person he was trying to stab
message:
CHICAGO — Chicago police fatally shot a stabbing suspect and wounded the person he was trying to stab after the suspect refused to drop his weapon, police said.
Officers were patrolling the city's west side about 11 p.m. Monday when they saw a male attempting to stab a male in the street and ordered the suspect to drop his weapon, police said.
When the suspect continued the attack, officers opened fire, wounding both the suspect and the victim, the Chicago Police Department said in a statement Tuesday morning.
The suspect was later pronounced dead at a hospital, and the other person was hospitalized in critical condition, police said.
The shooting occurred near the border of the Harrison and Austin police districts, two of Chicago's most violent districts, the Chicago Sun-Times reported.

.
- A male attempting to stab a male in the street
- Male suspect refusing to drop his weapon after police order
- Police officers shooting both the person being stabbed and the suspect
- Suspect being pronounced dead at the hospital
- The other person suffering critical injuries.

title: Reports : U . N . Security Council Prepares for Another Resolution Demanding Israel Stop Fighting Hamas
message:
Multiple reports on Tuesday indicated that representatives from Algeria had prepared a draft resolution for the United Nations Security Council that would demand Israel stop its self-defense operations against the terrorist group Hamas in Gaza.
Algeria called the U.N. Security Council meeting on Tuesday and reportedly prepared a resolution calling for an immediate end to operations in Rafah.
If passed, the proposed U.N. resolution would be the second time the Security Council calls for a ceasefire in Gaza.
The IDF began its operations in northern Gaza and has since pulled into Rafah, the Gaza Strip’s southernmost city, which borders Egypt.
The airstrike prompting the proposed resolution this week reportedly killed two senior members of the Hamas “Judea and Samaria” wing, Khaled Nagar and Yassin Rabia.

title: Rafah , Israel - Gaza : Charred Bodies , Children Screaming : Rafah Refugee Camp Recounts Horror
message:
The Rafah refugee camp in Gaza witnessed scenes of horror and devastation in the wake of an Israeli airstrike on Sunday.
Gaza's civil defence agency reported that the death count had risen to 45 from the overnight strikes, which ignited tents and sparked widespread condemnation across the globe.
The agency described the aftermath as a "massacre," with many bodies charred beyond recognition and numerous victims suffering severe injuries.
By morning, the charred remains of tents and vehicles were all that was left of the refugee camp in Rafah known as the Kuwaiti Al-Salam Camp 1.
The conflict, the deadliest in Gaza's history, began with a deadly attack by Hamas on southern Israel on October 7, resulting in 1,189 Israeli deaths and 252 hostages taken.

title: Oman reiterates condemnation of Israeli aggression
message:
Muscat: The Sultanate of Oman expressed its strong condemnation and denunciation of the continued Israeli aggression targeting the camps for displaced people in Rafah in the Gaza Strip.
AFP journalists in Rafah reported new strikes early Wednesday, hours after witnesses and a Palestinian security source said Israeli tanks had penetrated the heart of the city.
"People are currently inside their homes because Israeli drones are shooting at anyone who moves," resident Abdel Khatib said.
"We have not seen them smash into Rafah," said the US National Security Council spokesman John Kirby.
Israel's army rejected allegations that it had carried out Tuesday's strike in a designated humanitarian area.

message:

title: Sudan : El Fasher Engulfed in Violence as Hospitals Suffer Repeated Attacks
message:
In El Fasher, Sudan, relentless conflict exposes civilians to constant danger, with escalating attacks including patients and healthcare workers in the casualties, as highlighted by Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF).
Recent assaults have damaged all three major health centers in El Fasher, following attacks on the MSF-backed South Hospital, leaving two out of three facilities operational amid confrontations between Sudanese Armed Forces and Rapid Support Forces in the heart of North Darfur.
“El Fasher is witnessing a horrific escalation of combat, leaving no moment of peace for civilians.
“Due to the escalating violence, South Hospital has become overwhelmed, managing over 1,000 casualties since hostilities erupted on 10 May,” reports Abdifatah Yusuf Ibrahim from MSF.
Tragedy struck an MSF worker on 25 May when his residence, near El Fasher’s central market, was destroyed in an attack, underscoring that no location in El Fasher is immune to the conflict’s reach.
event_breakdown:
- MSF reports on escalating conflict in El Fasher, Sudan.
- Recent assaults have damaged all major health centers in El Fasher.
- MSF's South Hospital, the only facility that provides internal medicine services in El Fasher, has been handling over 1,000 casualties since the recent waves of fighting commenced.
- Local MSF personnel were evacuated as a bomb landed in front of the South Hospital.
- A bomb struck near MSF's warehouse/equipment room recently, causing widespread damage.

title: Air Force : Ukraine downs 13 Russian drones overnight
message:
Ukrainian air defenses shot down 13 of the 14 Shahed-type attack drones launched during a Russian attack overnight on May 29, according to Ukraine's Air Force Commander, Mykola Oleshchuk.
The drones were reportedly launched from the Russian port town of Primorsko-Akhtarsk, located on the coast of the Azov Sea.
The town lies approximately 153 kilometers (95 miles) from Kerch, which is located on the Crimean Peninsula that Russia annexed from Ukraine in 2014.
Aircraft, missile and electronic warfare units, and mobile fire groups of the Ukrainian Air Force intercepted the drones over Mykolaiv, Kirovohrad, and Rivne oblasts, the Air Force said in its morning update.
In recent months, Russia has intensified attacks against Ukraine's energy infrastructure, launching massive drone and missile strikes targeting critical facilities.

title: Underwater detonation of WWII - era shells closes popular beaches in southern Okinawa
message:
Japanese authorities detonate 30 World War II-era shells off Miyako Island, Okinawa, May 28, 2024.
(Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force)CAMP FOSTER, Okinawa — Japanese authorities safely detonated 30 shells believed to be left over from World War II this week on Miyakojima, a popular tourist destination 170 miles southwest of Okinawa’s main island.
The ordnance was discovered in December during dredging at Port Hirara, a hub for many ferries and cargo ships.
Popular tourist destinations, including Painagama and Sunayama beaches, where off-limits during the operation.
Approximately 10,000 tons of ordnance were dropped on Okinawa during the Battle of Okinawa and nearly 2,000 tons remain undiscovered, according to the prefecture’s General Bureau website.

Security Events:

* 2,000 tons of undiscovered ordnance on Okinawa.
* Unexploded WWII-era ordnance discovered in port dredging at Port Hirara, Miyakojima, December 2024.
* Popular beaches Painagama and Sunayama off-limits during ordnance disposal operations.

title: West Michigan World War II veteran laid to rest 80 years after death
message:
After 80 years, U.S. Army Air Force 1st Lieutenant Richard J. Kasten, 24, of Kalamazoo, was laid to rest in Battle Creek Tuesday during a ceremony.
Local:On Jan. 21, 1944, Kasten's plane, known as an American heavy bomber, crashed near Lignières-Châtelain, killing four of its 11 crewmembers.
German forces recovered three sets of remains from the crash, which were later interred in the French cemetery at Poix-de-la-Somme, according to the DPAA.
About 75 years later in April 2019, DPAA historians and American Battle Monuments personnel exhumed the remains, including a set designated as X-411 St. Andre, from Suresnes American Cemetery, officials said.
Using anthropological analysis and mitochondrial DNA, scientists determined that the remains of X-411 belonged to Kasten, according to the DPAA.
event_breakdown:
* January 21, 1944: An American heavy bomber plane crashed near Lignières-Châtelain, France, killing four of its 11 crewmembers.
* April 2019: Remains of American soldier Richard J. Kasten, who had been on the plane, were exhumed from Suresnes American Cemetery in France.

title: Artillery : Missile Merchants of Israel
message:
In 2023 Israel used Shavit to launch Ofek (Horizon) 13, the latest version of its Ofek surveillance satellites.
Ofek satellites have proved very reliable and are now built to recover from problems that often lead to the loss of satellites from other nations.
For example, in late 2016 Israel launched Ofek 11.
In addition to photo satellites, Israel also has a military-grade radar satellite called TekSar.
In 2021 Israel sold Vietnam a military surveillance satellite that Israel built and launched.

3. In addition to photo satellites, Israel also has a military-grade radar satellite called TekSar.
4. Israel sells Vietnam a military surveillance satellite that Israel built and launched in 2021.

title: Palestinians flee Rafah as Israeli assault intensifies
message:
Palestinians flee Rafah as Israeli assault intensifiesWorld World Palestinians flee Rafah as Israeli assault intensifiesHundreds braved roads in Rafah in south Gaza Tuesday as they fled Israel's expanding ground assault.
Rafah city on the Palestinian territory's southern border with Egypt has been under Israeli ground assault since early May.
Yasser Adwan, a 22-year-old resident of west Rafah, told AFP that "Israeli drones targeted anyone moving or walking in the streets of Rafah".
Yasser Adwan in west Rafah told AFP tanks had also taken up position "on the Al-Awda roundabout in the centre of the city of Rafah".
The UN Palestinian refugee agency, UNRWA, reported Tuesday that "around one million people" fled Rafah over the past three weeks.
event_breakdown: Ground assault, drones targeting, tanks taking up position.

title: Israeli strikes kill at least 37 , most in tents , near Gaza Rafah
message:
Israeli ground troops and tanks have been operating in eastern Rafah, in central parts of the city, and along the Gaza-Egypt border.
"It was a night of horror," said Abdel-Rahman Abu Ismail, a Palestinian from Gaza City who has been sheltering in Tel al-Sultan since December.
On Tuesday afternoon, an Israeli drone strike hit tents near a field hospital by the Mediterranean coast west of Rafah, killing at least 21 people, including 13 women, Gaza's Health Ministry said.
Most of those living there had fled from the same neighborhood in Gaza City earlier in the war.
The fighting in Rafah has made it nearly impossible for humanitarian groups to import and distribute aid to southern Gaza.
event_breakdown:
* Israeli ground troops and tanks operating in eastern Rafah, in central parts of the city, and along the Gaza-Egypt border
* Israeli drone strike near a field hospital by the Mediterranean coast in Rafah, killing at least 21 people, including 13 women

title: Latest Israeli strikes kill at least 37 Palestinians
message:
The tent camp inferno has drawn widespread international outrage, including from some of Israel’s closest allies, over the military’s expanding offensive into Rafah.
The Israeli military suggested Sunday's blaze in the tent camp may have been caused by secondary explosions, possibly from Palestinian militants' weapons.
“It was a night of horror,” said Abdel-Rahman Abu Ismail, a Palestinian from Gaza City who has been sheltering in Tel al-Sultan since December.
The International Court of Justice has ordered Israel to halt its Rafah offensive as part of South Africa's case accusing Israel of committing genocide against the Palestinians in Gaza.
Most of those living there had fled from the same neighborhood in Gaza City earlier in the war.

* The Israeli military's expanding offensive into Rafah
* The tent camp inferno has drawn widespread international outrage, including from Israel's closest allies
* The military's suggestion (though not conclusive) that the camp fire may have been caused by secondary explosions from Palestinian militants' weapons
* The ordeal of Palestinians camping in Tel al-Sultan, who had to flee from another neighborhood in Gaza City earlier in the war.
* The ICJ has ordered Israel to halt its Rafah offensive, as part of a case against Israel for committing genocide against Palestinians in Gaza.

title: Israel shrugs off UNSC bid to  stop the killing  to continue Rafah assault | Gaza News
message:
Israel has continued its assault on Rafah, ignoring a draft resolution to the UN Security Council to “stop the killing” in the city in southern Gaza.
Previously, as it attacked targets in northern and central Gaza, Israel’s military had designated Rafah as a safe zone.
US President Joe Biden has joined the calls for Israel to refrain from launching a major military operation in Rafah.
“We have not seen them smash into Rafah,” said National Security Council spokesman John Kirby.
A civil defence official in Gaza said an Israeli strike on a displacement camp west of Rafah on Tuesday killed at least 21 people.

* Draft UN Security Council resolution to “stop the killing” in Rafah
* Israeli designation of Rafah as a safe zone during previous attacks
* US President Joe Biden's call for Israel to refrain from launching a major military operation in Rafah
* Israeli strike on a displacement camp west of Rafah, killing at least 21 people

The United States, Israel’s closest ally, reiterated its opposition to a major Israeli ground offensive in Rafah but said it did not believe such an operation was under way.
At least 12 of the dead on Tuesday were women, according to medical officials in the Hamas militant-run Palestinian enclave.
The Israeli military said its forces continued to operate in the Rafah area, without commenting on reported advances into the city center.
Hamas has said talks are pointless unless Israel ends its offensive in Rafah.
More than 36,000 Palestinians have been killed in Israel’s offensive, Gaza’s health ministry says.

title: Arrests made in gel bead gun attacks Sunday in San Mateo
message:
SAN MATEO – Three men were arrested in connection with a series of drive-by gel bead gun shootings over the weekend in San Mateo, police said.
A second shooting happened an hour later in the 3300 block of Los Prados Street and a third shooting happened around 9 p.m. in the 700 block of Monte Diablo Avenue.
Police said the suspects shot the husband several times, drove away and returned to shoot him again, narrowly missing his eyes.
Inside the car, officers found three Hydro Strike Pulsar gel bead guns and a bottle of Gel-Tek gel beads, police said.
The occupants of the BMW – identified as a 19-year-old man and two 20-year-old men, all of San Mateo – were arrested and booked into San Mateo County jail on charges of assault with a deadly weapon and conspiracy to commit a crime, police said.

Brief:
Shootings in San Mateo, CA, on Los Prados and Monte Diablo Avenue
Shooting in San Mateo, CA, injuring husband
Drive-by shooting in San Mateo, CA
Three suspects arrested in San Mateo, CA
Three incidents of gel bead gun shootings in San Mateo reported by authorities.

title: Saudi Arabia Accuses Israel of  Continuous Genocidal Massacres , Throwing Doubt on Biden Future Deal
message:
Saudi Arabia accused Israel on Wednesday of committing “continuous genocidal massacres” against Palestinians, casting the Biden administration’s efforts to broker a “normalization” deal between Israel and Saudi Arabia in doubt.
In a statement, the Saudi Foreign Ministry — which has taken a tougher line toward Israel than Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman (MBS) — accused Israel of deliberately targeting the tents of Palestinians in Gaza.
An Israeli investigation found that Hamas munitions, which may have been hit by shrapnel from the airstrike, likely caused fires.
The Biden administration has been trying to urge Israel to accept an end to the war in Gaza, and a Palestinian state, dangling the prospect of “normalization” with Saudi Arabia.
Israelis are opposed to a Palestinian state due to repeated terror attacks by Hamas from Gaza, which Palestinians controlled entirely after the Israeli “disengagement” of 2005.
event_breakdown:
Events:
- Hamas (a Palestinian group) fire munitions at Israel from Gaza.
- Israeli investigation of airstrike incident find out shrapnel of Hamas munitions caused fires on tents in Palestine.
- Israel endorses a two-state solution with Palestine to end wars in Gaza.
- Saudi Arabia opposes Israeli approach.

title: Israeli minister says Netanyahu  failing , calls for elections
message:
JERUSALEM (Reuters) - An Israeli cabinet minister accused Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's coalition of "failing miserably" amid the Gaza war on Wednesday, prompting a rebuke from Netanyahu's Likud party as political divisions deepen.
Knesset member Gadi Eisenkot, an observer in the war cabinet, said Netanyahu had failed on security and the economy and called for elections by year's end.
"It will take three to five years to stabilize [Gaza] and then many more years to build an alternative to Hamas."
Israel launched an air and ground offensive in Gaza last October vowing to destroy the Palestinian Islamist militant group Hamas.
In a statement on Telegram, the Likud party said Eisenkot and Israeli war cabinet minister Benny Gantz, Netanyahu's main challenger, were looking for excuses to quit the coalition at the height the war.
event_breakdown:
* An Israeli cabinet minister accused Netanyahu's coalition of "failing miserably" amid the Gaza war on Wednesday
* In October, Israel launched an air and ground offensive in Gaza to vow to destroy the Palestinian Islamist militant group Hamas

title: Sudan : Iran Intervention in Sudan Civil War Advances Its Geopolitical Goals - but Not Without Risks
message:
But Tehran has received little coverage of its military intervention in another deadly conflict: Sudan's civil war.
While the conflict in Sudan has gotten less global attention than those in Ukraine and Gaza, it is strategically significant for Tehran.
In 2014, Sudan closed Iran's cultural center and expelled its diplomatic officials for purportedly proselytizing Shiism in a predominantly Sunni country.
Making inroads in the HornThe civil war has provided an opportunity for Iran to correct course with Sudan.
And unlike the wars in Syria and Ukraine, in Sudan, Tehran has found itself in the awkward position of supporting an adversary of Russia, which sponsors the RSF.

- Sudan's civil war has provided an opportunity for Iran to correct course with Sudan

title: Indian Air Force Rafales Soar to Red Flag Alaska – Indian Defence Research Wing
message:
Indian Air Force Rafales Soar to Red Flag Alaska| BySOURCE: AFICREDIT IN IMAGEOn May 24th, a formidable force from the Indian Air Force (IAF) set off for Exercise Red Flag Alaska 24-2.
An Indian Air Force C-17A Globemaster III cargo aircraft, identified as CB-8008, provided crucial logistical support, while an Il-78MK Midair refueling aircraft), designated KJ-3450, ensured the long-range deployment could be achieved.
Their final destination: Eielson Air Force Base in Alaska, the heart of Red Flag-Alaska.
Red Flag-Alaska is a premier multi-national combat training exercise designed to hone the skills of participating aircrews in a realistic and challenging environment.
The hallmark of Red Flag is its multi-service, multi-platform approach.
location: Eielson Air Force Base in Alaska

Indian Air Force Rafale aircraft participate in Exercise Red Flag Alaska 24-2
Indian Air Force aircraft provide logistical and mid-air refueling support to Indian Air Force aircraft participating in exercise Red Flag Alaska 24-2
Indian Air Force aircraft fly to Eielson Air Force Base in Alaska, USA, to participate in Exercise Red Flag Alaska 24-2

title: National Security Council addresses terrorism , Gaza crisis
message:
National Security Council addresses terrorism, Gaza crisisANKARAThe National Security Council (MGK) meeting, chaired by President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan on May 28, drew attention to the activities of the PKK terrorists in Syria, stating that any attempt that threatens national security and the territorial integrity of the region will not be tolerated.
“Any fait accompli in violation of our national security and the territorial integrity of our neighbors will not be given an opportunity,” the statement released after the MGK meeting said, drawing attention to the PKK's election scheme in Syria.
In defiance of a United Nations Security Council (UNSC) resolution, the PYD/YPG, an offshoot of the PKK terrorist organization, called for illegal local elections in Syria, where a civil war has been raging since 2011.
The four-hour-long meeting reiterated Türkiye’s determination to eliminate terrorist organizations that target the country’s national security and safety in the region.
Israel's offensive has killed more than 36,000 people in Gaza, mostly civilians, according to the Hamas-run territory's health ministry.
event_breakdown:
1. National Security Council addresses terrorism, Gaza crisis
2. National Security Council draws attention to PKK terrorists in Syria
3. National Security Council says any attempt that threatens national security and territorial integrity of the region will not be tolerated.
4. Muslim Brotherhood's Egypt rejects report by Human Rights Council fact-finding mission on Gaza.
5. Examine the statement of the National Security Council following the meeting.
6. Muslim Brotherhood called upon the top UN rights body to hold a special session on the recent escalation in Israel and the Occupied Palestinian Territory to discuss the latest Israeli attacks on Palestinians in East Jerusalem and the violations of Al-Aqsa Mosque's sanctity.
7. The Gaza Strip is enduring power cuts of up to 16 hours per day, after Israel reduced the 120 megawatts of power it supplies from the 12 megawatts previously.
8. Israeli aggressions happend in violation of international law and decreed by UNSCR 338 and 465.
9. Israel's crackdown on Palestinian demonstrators in East Jerusalem and the attack on the Al-Aqsa Mosque compound has triggered violence in Hamas-controlled Gaza.
10. More than 36,000 people in Gaza were killed, mostly civilians.

title: North Korean trash balloons are dumping  filth  on South Korea
message:
Seoul, South Korea CNN —North Korea has adopted a new strategy to contend with its southern neighbor: sending floating bags of trash containing “filth” across the border, carried by massive balloons.
South Korean authorities said the balloons, which landed in several locations, were filled with "filth and garbage."
“All responsibility arising from the North Korean balloons lies entirely with North Korea, and we sternly warn North Korea to immediately stop its inhumane and low-level actions.”Local governments also sent messages to residents in the northern Gyeonggi and Gangwon provinces to warn of the “unidentified objects,” and advised against outdoor activities.
Kim compared North Korea’s actions to South Korea’s years-long practice of sending balloons with anti-North Korea leaflets towards her nation.
Earlier this year a South Korean research group has released rare footage that it claimed showed North Korean teenagers sentenced to hard labor for watching and distributing K-dramas.
event_breakdown: North Korean balloons with floating bags of trash and "filth" land in South Korea, critically injuring one person. South Korea blames North Korea for the incident.

title: A Jewish veteran from London prepares to commemorate the 80th anniversary of the D - Day landings
message:
Mervyn Kersh D-Day veteran who fought in the Normandy Campaign, at his home in London, Monday, April 8, 2024.
A Jewish veteran is preparing to commemorate the 80th anniversary of the D-Day landings.
Kersh will return to France next week for ceremonies marking the 80th anniversary of the D-Day landings and the Battle of Normandy that followed.
Growing up in a Jewish family in south London during the 1930s and ’40s, Kersh, now 99, was doubly motivated to defeat Adolf Hitler.
The French government in 2015 awarded Kersh the Legion d’Honneur, the country’s highest order of merit, for his participation in the Normandy campaign.

Events:
* Mervyn Kersh D-Day veteran.
* Mervyn Kersh fought in Normandy.
* Mervyn Kersh awarded Legion d’Honneur.
* Mervyn Kersh participated in Normandy Campaign.
